description: Deletes the specified link aggregation group (LAG). You cannot delete a LAG if it has active virtual interfaces or hosted connections.

nested_items.name: connectionsBandwidth
nested_items.description: The individual bandwidth of the physical connections bundled by the LAG. The possible values are 1Gbps, 10Gbps, 100Gbps, or 400 Gbps..

nested_items.name: numberOfConnections
nested_items.description: The number of physical dedicated connections initially provisioned and bundled by the LAG. You can have a maximum of four connections when the port speed is 1 Gbps or 10 Gbps, or two when the port speed is 100 Gbps or 400 Gbps.

nested_items.name: lagId
nested_items.description: The ID of the LAG.

nested_items.name: ownerAccount
nested_items.description: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that owns the LAG.

nested_items.name: lagName
nested_items.description: The name of the LAG.

nested_items.name: lagState
nested_items.description: The state of the LAG. The following are the possible values:
requested: The initial state of a LAG. The LAG stays in the requested state until the Letter of Authorization (LOA) is available.
pending: The LAG has been approved and is being initialized.
available: The network link is established and the LAG is ready for use.
down: The network link is down.
deleting: The LAG is being deleted.
deleted: The LAG is deleted.
unknown: The state of the LAG is not available.

nested_items.name: location
nested_items.description: The location of the LAG.

nested_items.name: region
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Region where the connection is located.

nested_items.name: minimumLinks
nested_items.description: The minimum number of physical dedicated connections that must be operational for the LAG itself to be operational.

nested_items.name: awsDevice
nested_items.description: The Direct Connect endpoint that hosts the LAG.

nested_items.name: awsDeviceV2
nested_items.description: The Direct Connect endpoint that hosts the LAG.

nested_items.name: awsLogicalDeviceId
nested_items.description: The Direct Connect endpoint that terminates the logical connection. This device might be different than the device that terminates the physical connection.

nested_items.name: connections
nested_items.description: The connections bundled by the LAG.

nested_items.name: ownerAccount
nested_items.description: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that owns the connection.

nested_items.name: connectionId
nested_items.description: The ID of the connection.

nested_items.name: connectionName
nested_items.description: The name of the connection.

nested_items.name: connectionState
nested_items.description: The state of the connection. The following are the possible values:

ordering: The initial state of a hosted connection provisioned on an interconnect. The connection stays in the ordering state until the owner of the hosted connection confirms or declines the connection order.
requested: The initial state of a standard connection. The connection stays in the requested state until the Letter of Authorization (LOA) is sent to the customer.
pending: The connection has been approved and is being initialized.
available: The network link is up and the connection is ready for use.
down: The network link is down.
deleting: The connection is being deleted.
deleted: The connection has been deleted.
rejected: A hosted connection in the ordering state enters the rejected state if it is deleted by the customer.
unknown: The state of the connection is not available.

nested_items.name: region
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Region where the connection is located.

nested_items.name: location
nested_items.description: The location of the connection.

nested_items.name: bandwidth
nested_items.description: The bandwidth of the connection.

nested_items.name: vlan
nested_items.description: The ID of the VLAN.

nested_items.name: partnerName
nested_items.description: The name of the Direct Connect service provider associated with the connection.

nested_items.name: loaIssueTime
nested_items.description: The time of the most recent call to  DescribeLoa for this connection.

nested_items.name: lagId
nested_items.description: The ID of the LAG.

nested_items.name: awsDevice
nested_items.description: The Direct Connect endpoint on which the physical connection terminates.

nested_items.name: jumboFrameCapable
nested_items.description: Indicates whether jumbo frames are supported.

nested_items.name: awsDeviceV2
nested_items.description: The Direct Connect endpoint that terminates the physical connection.

nested_items.name: awsLogicalDeviceId
nested_items.description: The Direct Connect endpoint that terminates the logical connection. This device might be different than the device that terminates the physical connection.

nested_items.name: hasLogicalRedundancy
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the connection supports a secondary BGP peer in the same address family (IPv4/IPv6).

nested_items.name: tags
nested_items.description: The tags associated with the connection.

nested_items.name: key
nested_items.description: The key.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: The value.

nested_items.name: providerName
nested_items.description: The name of the service provider associated with the connection.

nested_items.name: macSecCapable
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the connection supports MAC Security (MACsec).

nested_items.name: portEncryptionStatus
nested_items.description: The MAC Security (MACsec) port link status of the connection.

nested_items.name: encryptionMode
nested_items.description: The MAC Security (MACsec) connection encryption mode.

nested_items.name: macSecKeys
nested_items.description: The MAC Security (MACsec) security keys associated with the connection.

nested_items.name: secretARN
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the MAC Security (MACsec) secret key.

nested_items.name: ckn
nested_items.description: The Connection Key Name (CKN) for the MAC Security secret key.

nested_items.name: state
nested_items.description: The state of the MAC Security (MACsec) secret key.
associating: The MAC Security (MACsec) secret key is being validated and not yet associated with the connection or LAG.
associated: The MAC Security (MACsec) secret key is validated and associated with the connection or LAG.
disassociating: The MAC Security (MACsec) secret key is being disassociated from the connection or LAG.
disassociated: The MAC Security (MACsec) secret key is no longer associated with the connection or LAG.

nested_items.name: startOn
nested_items.description: The date that the MAC Security (MACsec) secret key takes effect. The value is displayed in UTC format.

nested_items.name: allowsHostedConnections
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the LAG can host other connections.

nested_items.name: jumboFrameCapable
nested_items.description: Indicates whether jumbo frames are supported.

nested_items.name: hasLogicalRedundancy
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the LAG supports a secondary BGP peer in the same address family (IPv4/IPv6).

nested_items.name: tags
nested_items.description: The tags associated with the LAG.

nested_items.name: key
nested_items.description: The key.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: The value.

nested_items.name: providerName
nested_items.description: The name of the service provider associated with the LAG.

nested_items.name: macSecCapable
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the LAG supports MAC Security (MACsec).

nested_items.name: encryptionMode
nested_items.description: The LAG MAC Security (MACsec) encryption mode.

nested_items.name: macSecKeys
nested_items.description: The MAC Security (MACsec) security keys associated with the LAG.

nested_items.name: secretARN
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the MAC Security (MACsec) secret key.

nested_items.name: ckn
nested_items.description: The Connection Key Name (CKN) for the MAC Security secret key.

nested_items.name: state
nested_items.description: The state of the MAC Security (MACsec) secret key.
associating: The MAC Security (MACsec) secret key is being validated and not yet associated with the connection or LAG.
associated: The MAC Security (MACsec) secret key is validated and associated with the connection or LAG.
disassociating: The MAC Security (MACsec) secret key is being disassociated from the connection or LAG.
disassociated: The MAC Security (MACsec) secret key is no longer associated with the connection or LAG.

nested_items.name: startOn
nested_items.description: The date that the MAC Security (MACsec) secret key takes effect. The value is displayed in UTC format.
